item.title: The Wanted's Tom Parker: 'I'm not paying attention to cancer'
item.description: "The more you pay attention to it, the more the cancer has control of you," says The Wanted star.

item.title: Oasis Knebworth 1996: 'We had no fear'
item.description: Noel Gallagher on the new film marking 25 years since his old band's era-defining gigs.

item.title: Jamie Campbell: We need more stories from outside London
item.description: A new film tells the story of a boy who lives on a council estate and is obsessed with drag.

item.title: Lil Nas X: Is the rapper the defining star of his generation?
item.description: The rapper has subverted hip-hop with his LGBT-positive lyrics, while dominating critics on social media.

item.title: Emmerdale: Actress Elizabeth Estensen leaving ITV soap after 22 years
item.description: Elizabeth Estensen, who played landlady Diane Sugden, says it is time to "say goodbye".

item.title: Andrew Neil: I was minority of one at GB News
item.description: The ex-BBC presenter who quit the channel says people can decide themselves if it is too right wing.

item.title: Vincent Van Gogh: Newly discovered drawing goes on display
item.description: Study for Worn Out has been sitting in a Dutch family's private collection for more than a century.

item.title: Piers Morgan to launch new show on Rupert Murdoch-owned network
item.description: It is the controversial presenter's first major new job since he left Good Morning Britain in March.

item.title: Little Mix promoter discriminated against deaf mums
item.description: LHG Live offered solutions in a "vacuum of ignorance" after concert interpreter request, says judge.

item.title: Sir Elton John: UK and European tour postponed to 2023 after hip injury
item.description: The rock star says it "breaks my heart" to postpone, but he is still recovering from a hip injury.

item.title: Sara Pascoe revealed as new Great British Sewing Bee host
item.description: The comic and writer is taking over from Joe Lycett, who has hosted the last three series.

item.title: Help: Channel 4 drama examines 'undervalued' care workers during pandemic
item.description: A new Channel 4 film starring Jodie Comer and Stephen Graham is set in the early days of the pandemic.

item.title: Alex Echo: Artist reveals 'shock' over Parkinson's diagnosis
item.description: Alex Echo has been forced to give up most of his painting work, but is now championing digital art.

item.title: Afghanistan's singers flee Taliban violence
item.description: The BBC spoke with six singers who crossed to Pakistan illegally and are now living in hiding.

item.title: Nicki Minaj swollen testicles claim 'wasted' Trinidad health officials' time
item.description: The rapper's comments about vaccines side effects were explored by Trinidad's health minister.

item.title: Covid: Isle of Wight Festival safer than supermarket, says boss
item.description: The Isle of Wight Festival kicks off for four days of music in Newport.

item.title: Wellbeing: Samaritans volunteering inspires Big Panda tales
item.description: Volunteering for the suicide prevention charity helps author write inspirational wellbeing book.

item.title: Deathloop reviews: 'Ingenious' shooter is a contender for game of the year
item.description: The action thriller, which takes place in a time loop, delights critics as it debuts on Playstation 5.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing: How Rose Ayling-Ellis will hear the music
item.description: EastEnders star Rose Ayling-Ellis will become the show's first deaf contestant later this month.

item.title: Iranian musician risks prison for new album
item.description: Mehdi Rajabian made an album in secret in his basement despite threats from Iranian authorities.

item.title: Met Gala: 13 of the most eye-catching looks
item.description: Jennifer Lopez, Simone Biles, Dan Levy, Ella Emhoff and Tommy Hilfiger were all on the red carpet.

item.title: Sparks fly at MTV Awards, but not many are on stage
item.description: After a scuffle on the red carpet, the ceremony struggles to generate many big new cultural moments.

item.title: The Wanted's Tom Parker opens up about his cancer diagnosis
item.description: Tom refuses to let cancer dominate his life after being diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumour.

item.title: Andrew Neil on GB News: 'I was in a minority of one'
item.description: The broadcaster Andrew Neil spoke to the BBC's Question Time about his reasons for leaving GB News.

item.title: Louise Minchin: BBC Breakfast bids presenter goodbye
item.description: One of BBC Breakfast's main presenters, Louise Minchin, has broadcast her final programme after 20 years of early morning alarm calls.

item.title: Met Gala 2021: Which celeb shone brightest on the red carpet?
item.description: After skipping last year because of coronavirus, celebrities went all out in the fashion stakes.

item.title: Ex-Love Islander Amy Hart on online abuse and trolling
item.description: Amy Hart says social media users should be required to verify their identities by using an NI number.

item.title: The Biff, Chip and Kipper books adapted into TV show
item.description: From the classroom to the small screen; meet the actors playing Biff, Chip and Kipper.
